overview_of_class: This course provides an introductory look at the "rules of the game" in local politics, with an emphasis on Chicago and other large American cities. What key forces and institutions shape local politics? Why do some cities respond to powerful social forces differently than others? What are the implications for democratic responsiveness and civic outcomes? Where did they originate and how have they developed and interacted to create the distinctive political traditions of our cities? This course engages these questions from a historical-institutional perspective.
name: Urban Politics
subject: POLI_SCI
